result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon S Gallagher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $100/month start 12/1/15 for court cost.
$250 to be posted today and to be held until restitution is determined. State has 60 days to determine restitution, defendant has 30 days to request hearing & if there's a dispute we will have a hearing.  Bond money held for restitution.

10 days to be served on EM through JSS over 5 weekends - as to remaining days - after that 2 days every weekend pursuant to 973.03(3) but that can be worked off by doing 8 hours community service in lieu of jail. Do 5 weekends in jail, remaining 10 weekends can be worked off through community service at 8 hours during the weekend or he can simply do that on EM if he doesn't want to do the community service.

records.addlTxt:
from JSS   re: update:  def has been compliant w/ EM & continues to be compliant
Noted per SLH

3:13 PM - Def in court w/Atty James D Thibodeau.  Rukmini Vasupuram appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
VASUPURAM: he does have a small criminal hx. I am asking for probation given his hx and he hurt 2 others. VICTIM: I have known him for a long time  and he has a severe issue w/ drinking. I lived above Auggie's bar in Bangor and he and the owner were very close and I bartended there. I know how good of a guy he can be and how mean he can be. THIBODEAU: she didn't call the police b/c she was drunk. VICTIM: I was working and not drnking. THIBODEAU: I know the owners of this bar for a very long time and talked to them, she wasn't working she was drinking. She went to the dr the next day and then called the def and made a stmt. He doesn't have any drug problems. There was alc in this one and he admitted it. He's gone all the time working. CRT: you plead G to DC & Bat if that plea is maintained you will be sentenced accordingly. I won't take a plea to crim charges but then assume at SEH that you weren't G of those charges. DEF: I will stand by my plea. I am sorry this all happened. We were celebrating me  getting this job in IL CRT: compas has low risk needs.  I will rely on the compas to determine the need for probation and that suggests probation isn't needed. 
SENTENCE: 30 days CJ  - 10 to be served on EM TO BE SERVED OVER 5 WEEKENDS - as to the remaining days -  after that 2 DAYS EVERY WEEKEND - pursuant to  973.03(3) BUT THAT CAN BE WORKED OFF BY DOING 8 HRS COM SERVICE IN LIEU OF JAIL. do 5 wkends in jail, remaining 10 wkends can be worked off thru com service at 8 hrs during the weekend or he can simply do that on EM if he doesn't want to do to the com service
post $250.00 w/ the COC office today TO BE HELD UNTIL REST IS DETERMINED. In the event there is a rest order the money will be used toward that first. State has 60 days to determine rest. def has 30 days to request hearing and if there's a dispute we will have a hearing. 
pay $443.00 CC
ext: def to pay $100/mo eff 12/1/15 or CJ
